correction_response:
This tweet is misleading. The Keller Independent School District in Texas did not ban Anne Frank's diary. The graphic novel adaptation of the diary was briefly removed for review due to a parental challenge, but it was not banned and has since been returned to library shelves. The standard edition of the diary was never challenged or removed. The district's superintendent clarified that books passing the new standards would be returned to the shelves "very soon".
